intro: Pedicularis rhinanthoides, commonly known as the yellow monkey orchid, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, commonly known as the broomrape family, and is characterized by its parasitic growth habit. The plant produces striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and clustered at the base, while the stems are often branched. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in alpine meadows and forested areas.
